priorityQueue
Class HeapPriorityQueue<K,V>

java.lang.Object
  priorityQueue.HeapPriorityQueue<K,V>
Type Parameters:
K - the key.
V - the value.
All Implemented Interfaces:
PriorityQueue<K,V>
Direct Known Subclasses:
HeapAdaptablePriorityQueue
public class HeapPriorityQueue<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements PriorityQueue<K,V>

The HeapPriorityQueue represents an unbounded PriorityQueue based on a priority heap.This queue orders elements according to an order specified at construction time, which is specified either according to their natural order (see DefaultComparator), or according to a Comparator, depending on which constructor is used. A constructor that create an HeapPriorityQueue in linear time is also provided. A PriorityQueue does not permit null keys.

Version:
1.0
Author:
SuperJulietta

Method Detail

insert

public Entry<K,V> insert(K key,
                         V value)
                  throws InvalidKeyException
Inserts an entry in this HeapPriorityQueue. If a violation of the heap-order property succeed the up-heap method is invoked to restore this property.

Specified by:

               throws EmptyPriorityQueueException

Throws:

removeMin

public Entry<K,V> removeMin()
                     throws EmptyPriorityQueueException
Returns the entry with the minimum key removing it. We know that an entry with the smallest key is stored at the root r of the heap. However, unless r is the only internal node of the heap, we cannot simply delete r. Besides, the heap-order property must be restored. So downHeap method is invoked.

Specified by:
removeMin in interface PriorityQueue<K,V>
Returns:
the entry with the minimum key.
Throws:
EmptyPriorityQueueException - if this HeapPriorityQueue is empty.

upHeap

protected void upHeap(Position<Entry<K,V>> entry)
In a heap T, for every node v other than the root, the key stored at v is greater than or equal to the key stored at v's parent. Let be z the parent of v. If key(z)> key(v) heap-order property must be restored.

Parameters:
entry - the entry to move up of one level.

downHeap

protected void downHeap(Position<Entry<K,V>> entry)
In a heap T, for every node v other than the root, the key stored at v is greater than or equal to the key stored at v's parent. Let be z the parent of v. If key(z)> key(v) heap-order property must be restored.

Parameters:
entry - the entry to move up of one level.
